mygame

Class StopWatch

  • java.lang.Object
    • mygame.StopWatch

  • public class StopWatch
extends java.lang.Object
    The StopWatch class is used as a timer.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StopWatch()
      The default constructor initializes the time to be 3 minutes.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long getMinute()
      Returns the number of minutes remaining in the stopwatch.
      long getSecond()
      Returns the number of seconds remaining in the stopwatch.
      int getTime(com.jme3.font.BitmapText hudText2, long time)
      Adjusts the time remaining in the HUD.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • StopWatch

        public StopWatch()
        The default constructor initializes the time to be 3 minutes.

    • Method Detail

      • getSecond

        public long getSecond()
        Returns the number of seconds remaining in the stopwatch.
        Returns:
        the value of seconds.

      • getMinute

        public long getMinute()
        Returns the number of minutes remaining in the stopwatch.
        Returns:
        the value of minutes.

      • getTime

        public int getTime(com.jme3.font.BitmapText hudText2,
          long time)
        Adjusts the time remaining in the HUD.
        Parameters:
        hudText2 - the HUD where the timer is going to be placed.
        time - the time when an action was done.
        Returns:
        1-if time has reached more than 3 minutes.
